item.title: Parsing Elf and Dwarf Files on Linux with the Zig Standard Library: Part 1
item.description: Background Recently, I’ve been pretty into debuggers. With the recent development of the RAD Debugger Project, RemedyBG’s continued existence, and smaller projects like Spray, I became interested in how they work under the hood. So I set out to try to craft a (simple) debugger on my own. Unfortunately, I decided to start at the harder part of crafting a debugger, parsing ELF and DWARF. Ok, to be fair, they are not ESPECIALLY difficult, but there is a severe lack of resources available on the subject (please correct me if I’m wrong here).

item.title: Howdy, world!
item.description: Howdy, world. My name is Bryson Miller, and this is my personal website. Here I will be discussing topics in the fields of programming, music, and health. Since I just graduated from college, I have a lot more free time now. I also have lot of thoughtsâ„¢. This blog will mainly serve as a one-off dumping ground for any interesting problems/solutions or ideas that I’ve come across while going about my day job or hobby projects.

item.title: About
item.description: Bryson Miller: Software Engineer based in SF. Interested in low-level programming, performance, systems. Outside of programming I love drumming and working out. Find me on GitHub (code) and Youtube (long form educational content). Powered by Hugo using the Basics theme.
